title: Dr. Dennis Ulbrich
text:
Email
  
  
    
     LinkedIn
  

  
  






Open to job offers



I am currently looking for a postdoc position in Mathematics (research and/or teaching), ideally in line with my research interests, and would be delighted to receive any suitable offers or suggestions.




I am currently looking for a postdoc position in Mathematics (research and/or teaching), ideally in line with my research interests, and would be delighted to receive any suitable offers or suggestions.



In the winter semester 2024/25, I was a lecturer at Hochschule Bremen.
Beforehand, I was a postdoctoral researcher at the Institute for Analysis and Numerics of the University of Münster. I was supervised by Prof. M. Pirner. Currently, a related publication is in progress.
I earned my PhD degree in Mathematics (Dr. rer. nat. in Mathematics) at the University of Bremen under the supervision of Prof. J. Rademacher and Prof. M. Keßeböhmer, cf. MGP.

title: Dr. Dennis Ulbrich
text: I am currently looking for a postdoc position in Mathematics (research and/or teaching), ideally in line with my research interests, and would be delighted to receive any suitable offers or suggestions.

title: Dr. Dennis Ulbrich
text:
In the winter semester 2024/25, I was a lecturer at Hochschule Bremen.
Beforehand, I was a postdoctoral researcher at the Institute for Analysis and Numerics of the University of Münster. I was supervised by Prof. M. Pirner. Currently, a related publication is in progress.
I earned my PhD degree in Mathematics (Dr. rer. nat. in Mathematics) at the University of Bremen under the supervision of Prof. J. Rademacher and Prof. M. Keßeböhmer, cf. MGP.

title: Research
text:
Ordinary and partial differential equations and their dynamics
Dynamical Systems and Ergodic Theory
Kinetic Theory and Entropy methods
Boltzmann equation and its BGK-type approximations
Long-time behavior of solutions (Hypocoercivity)
Models of chemical reactions
Physical applications

title: Research
text:

title: Research
text:
Publications

In progress

Discrete hypocoercivity for a nonlinear generation-recombination model. (working title)  joint work with L. Liu and M. Pirner



Refereed journal articles

A. Pauthier, J.D.M. Rademacher, D. Ulbrich. Weak and strong interaction of excitation kinks in scalar parabolic equations. J Dyn Diff Equat. Published 30 July 2021; Volume 35, pages 2199-2235, (2023) [DOI] [arXiv]
M. Keßeböhmer, J.D.M. Rademacher, D. Ulbrich. Dynamics and topological entropy of 1D Greenberg-Hastings cellular automata. Ergodic Theory and Dynamical Systems. 2021;41(5):1397-1430 [DOI] [arXiv]



Theses

D. Ulbrich. Ergodic theory of nonlinear waves in discrete and continuous excitable media. Dissertation, 2021 [DOI]
